InventorySettings_Update.InStockMessageLong: We've got plenty so order away
InventorySettings_Update.LowStockMessageLong: There are only a few left in stock, so you better get em while you can
InventorySettings_Update.OutOfStockMessageLong: This product is SOLD OUT but hopefully we'll get more in soon

AttributeTemplateAttribute_Add.Prompt: Would you like to add spikes to the armor? (+500 sp)
Would you like to add spikes to the shield? (+100 sp)

Product_Add.Name: Ale, gallon jug
Product_Add.Description: A gallon jug of quality ale.

Product_Update.Name: Ale, gallon jug
Product_Update.Description: A gallon jug of quality ale.

Product_Add.Name: Ale, mug full
Product_Add.Description: A mug with a sealed lid. Pull off the lid and enjoy the fine spirits.

Product_Add.Name: Leather Armor
Product_Add.Description: The breastplate and shoulder protectors of this armor are made of leather that has been stiffened by boiling in oil. The rest of the armor is softer and more flexable leather. (+2 to AC)

Product_Add.Name: Padded Armor
Product_Add.Description: Padded armor features quilted layers of cloth and batting(+1 to AC)

Product_Add.Name: Studded Leather Armor
Product_Add.Description: This armor is made from tough but flexable leather (Not hardened leather as with normal leather armor) reinforced with close-set metal rivets. (+3 to AC)

Product_Add.Name: Arrows(20)
Product_Add.Description: Arrows come in a leather quiver that holds 20 arrows.

Product_Add.Name: Silvered Arrow (each)
Product_Add.Description: A silvered arrow functions as a normal arrow, but very useful against creatures that can only be hurt by silver weapons.

Product_Add.Name: Battle Axe
Product_Add.Description: The battleaxe is the most common melee weapon among dwarves (1d8 damage)

Product_Add.Name: Great Axe
Product_Add.Description: This big, heavy axe is a favorite fo barbarians or anybody else who wants the capability to deal out incredible damage(1d12 damage)

Product_Add.Name: Handaxe
Product_Add.Description: Dwarves favor these axes as off-hand weapons (1d6 damage)

Product_Add.Name: Throwing Axe
Product_Add.Description: A throwing axe is lighter than a handaxe and is balanced for throwing. (1d6 damage)

Product_Add.Name: Backpack (Empty)
Product_Add.Description: A leather pack carried on the back, typically with straps to secure it

Product_Add.Name: Bedroll
Product_Add.Description: Adventures never know where they're going to sleep! A bedroll is bedding and a blanket thin enough to be rolled up and tied.

Product_Add.Name: Winter Blanket
Product_Add.Description: A thick, quilted wool blanket

Product_Add.Name: Crossbow Bolts(10)
Product_Add.Description: Bolts come in a wooden case that holds ten bolts.

Product_Add.Name: Silvered Bolt (each)
Product_Add.Description: A silvered bolt functions as a normal bolt, but very useful against creatures that can only be hurt by silver weapons.

Product_Add.Name: Longbow
Product_Add.Description: You need at least two hands to use a bow, regardless of size. (1d8 damage)

Product_Add.Name: Shortbow
Product_Add.Description: You need at least two hands to use a bow, regardless of size. (1d6 damage)

Product_Add.Name: Loaf of Bread
Product_Add.Description: A wrapped, uncut loaf of hearty bread.

Product_Add.Name: Caltrops
Product_Add.Description: Caltrops resembles large metal jacks with sharpened points on the ends of their arms. They are designed to always have one point facing up. Each bag will cover 5 square feet

Product_Add.Name: Candle
Product_Add.Description: A candle clearly illuminates a 5-foot radius and burns for one hour.

Product_Add.Name: Hunk of Cheese
Product_Add.Description: A half-pound wedge of cheese wrapped in cloth for protection.

Product_Add.Name: Treasure Chest(Empty)
Product_Add.Description: Standard adventurer's treasure chest. Traps and locks are optional.

Product_Add.Name: Club
Product_Add.Description: A wooden club, hand crafted and hardened to be more resilient that what you'd find on the side of the road. (1d6 damage)

Product_Add.Name: Heavy Crossbow
Product_Add.Description: A heavy crossbow requires two hands to use, and is drawn back by a winch. (1d10 damage)

Product_Add.Name: Light Crossbow
Product_Add.Description: A light crossbow requires two hands to use to, regardless of the users size. (1d8 damage)

Product_Add.Name: Crowbar
Product_Add.Description: An iron bar for levering things open.

Product_Add.Name: Dagger
Product_Add.Description: The dagger is a common seconary weapon. (1d4 damage)

Product_Add.Name: Silvered Dagger
Product_Add.Description: A silvered dagger functions as a normal dagger, but very useful against creatures that can only be hurt by silver weapons.

Product_Add.Name: Darts
Product_Add.Description: A dart is the size of a large arrow and has a weighted head.(1d4 damage)

Product_Add.Name: Firewood bundle
Product_Add.Description: A bundle of split wood, and small kindling to help start the pile burning

Product_Add.Name: Flint And Steel
Product_Add.Description: Striking the steel and flint together creates sparks. By knocking the sparks into tinder, you can start a small flame.

Product_Add.Name: Gauntlets
Product_Add.Description: These metal gloves protect your hands and let you deal normal damage with unarmed strikes. (1d4 damage)

Product_Add.Name: Grappling Hook
Product_Add.Description: Tied to the end of a rope, the hook can secure the rope to battlements, windows, tree limbs, and so forth.

Product_Add.Name: Standard hammer
Product_Add.Description: A one-handed hammer with an iron head that is useful for pounding pitons.

Product_Add.Name: Holy Symbol, silver
Product_Add.Description: A holy symbol focuses positive energy. Can be used as the focus of spells and as tools for turning undead. Although silver works no better than wood, it makes for a great status symbol.

Product_Add.Name: Holy Symbol, wooden
Product_Add.Description: A holy symbol focuses positive energy. Can be used as the focus of spells and as tools for turning undead.

Product_Add.Name: Holy Water
Product_Add.Description: Holy water damages undead and evil 'outsiders' almost as if it were acid. (2d4 damage to evil, 1 splash damage)

Product_Add.Name: Ink and Inkpen
Product_Add.Description: The inkpen is a wooden stick with a special tip at the end. The tip draws ink in when dipped in a vial and leaves ink trails when drawn across the surface. The ink in black in color. Other colors are available for an additional fee.

Product_Add.Name: Common Musical Instrument
Product_Add.Description: Choose your favorite instrument from our wide selection

Product_Add.Name: Kama
Product_Add.Description: A monk using a kama can strike with his or her unarmed attack bonus. (1d4 damage)

Product_Add.Name: Climber's Kit
Product_Add.Description: Special pitons, boot tips, gloves, and a harness that aids in all sorts of climbing.

Product_Add.Name: Disguise Kit
Product_Add.Description: A bag containing cosmetics, hair dye, and small physical props. Good for about 10 uses.

Product_Add.Name: Healer's Kit
Product_Add.Description: This kit is full of herbs, salves, bandages, and other useful materials. Good for about 10 uses.

Product_Add.Name: Kukri
Product_Add.Description: This heavy, curved dagger has its sharp edge on the inside of the curve. (1d4 damage)

Product_Add.Name: Alchemist's Lab
Product_Add.Description: This includes beakers, bottles, mixing and measuring equipment and a miscellany of chemicals and substances.

Product_Add.Name: Lantern, Bullseye
Product_Add.Description: A bullseye lantern has only a single shutter, with it's sides being highly polished inside to reflect the light in a single direction. It illuminates a cone 60 feet long and 20 feet wide at the end and burns for 6 hours on a pint of oil.

Product_Add.Name: Lamp, Common
Product_Add.Description: A lamp clearly illuminates things in a 15-foot radius and burns for 6 hours on a pint of oil. It burns more even than a torch.

Product_Add.Name: Lantern, Hooded
Product_Add.Description: A hooded lantern is a standard lantern with shuttered or hinged sides. You can carry a lantern in one hand. It clearly illuminates a 30-foot radius and burns for 6 hours on a pint of oil.

Product_Add.Name: Long Spear
Product_Add.Description: A longspear has reach. You can strike oppenents 10-feet away with it, but you can't use it against an adjacent foe. (1d8 damage)

Product_Add.Name: Mace
Product_Add.Description: The mace is made of matel, even the haft, making it quite heavy and very hard to break. (1d6 damage)

Product_Add.Name: Chainmail
Product_Add.Description: This armor is made of interlocking metal rings. It includes a layer of quilted faberic underneath to prevent chafing and to cushion the impact of blows. It also includes gauntlets (+5 to AC)

Product_Add.Name: Full Platemail
Product_Add.Description:
This armor consists of shaped and fitted metal plates riveted and interlocked to cover the entire body. In includes gauntlets, heavy leather boots, and a visored helmet. This set also includes a think layer of padding for underneath. Buckles and straps distribute the weight over the body, so full plate hampers movement less than splint mail even though splint in lighter.
Each suit of full plate mail must be individually fitted to it's owner by our master armorsmith. (+8 to AC)

InventoryProductSettings_Update.InStockMessageLong: We still have a few left, but it still needs custom fitting
InventoryProductSettings_Update.LimitedStockMessage: Sorry, but these are hand crafted works. I cannot create that many at once. Try 1 or 2 at a time.

Product_Add.Name: Platemail
Product_Add.Description: This armor is a combination of chainmail with metal plates covering vital areas. Buckles and straps hold the whole suit together and distribute the weight, but the amor still hangs more loosely than full platemail. It includes gauntlets. (+7 to AC)

Product_Add.Name: Scalemail
Product_Add.Description: This is a coat and leggings (and perhaps a separate skirt) of leather covered with overlapping pieces of metal, much like the scales of a fish. It includes gauntlets (+4 to AC)

Product_Add.Name: Splintmail
Product_Add.Description: This armor is made of narrow, vertical strips of metal rivited to a backing of leather that is worn over cloth padding. Includes gauntlets. (+6 to AC)

Product_Add.Name: Chunk of Meat
Product_Add.Description: Cured meat - Lasts for long adventures

Product_Add.Name: Mirror
Product_Add.Description: A polished steel mirror is handy when you want to look around corners, signal friends with reflected sunlight, keep an eye on a medusa, make sure you look good enough to present yourself to the queen, or examine wounds that you've received on hard-to-see parts of your body.

Product_Add.Name: Nunchaku
Product_Add.Description: A monk using a nunchaku can strike with his or her unarmed attack bonus. (1d6 damage)

Product_Add.Name: Oil (1-pint flask)
Product_Add.Description: A pint of oil burns for 6-hours in a lantern.It can also be thrown as a weapon, or spilled on the ground to cover a 5 foot area.

Product_Add.Name: Cleric's Vestments
Product_Add.Description: Ecclesiastical clothes for performing priestly functions, not for adventuring.

Product_Add.Name: Cold Weather Gear
Product_Add.Description: A wool coat, linen shirt, wool cap, heavy cloak, think pants or skirt, and boots.

Product_Add.Name: Entertainer's Outfit
Product_Add.Description: A set of flashy, perhaps even gaudy, clothes for entertaining.

Product_Add.Name: Explorer's Outfit
Product_Add.Description: This is a full set of clothes for someone who never knows what to expect. It includes sturdy boots, leather breeches or a skirt, a belt, a shirt, a vest, gloves, and a cloak.

Product_Add.Name: Monk's Outfit
Product_Add.Description: This simple outfit includes sandals, loose breeches, and a loose shirt, and is all bound together with sashes. Although it looks casual, the outfit is designed to give you maximum mobility, and is made from high-quality fabric.

Product_Add.Name: Peasant's Outfit
Product_Add.Description: A loose shirt and baggy breeches. Cloth wrappings are used for shoes.

Product_Add.Name: Traveler's Outfit
Product_Add.Description: Boots, a wool skirt or breeches, a sturdy belt, a shirt, a vest, and an ample cloak with a hood.

Product_Add.Name: Belt Pouch
Product_Add.Description: This leather pounch straps to your belt. It's good for holding things that you may need in a hurry, such as potions.

Product_Add.Name: Punch Daggers
Product_Add.Description: This dagger puts the full force of the wielder's punch behind it. (1d4 damage)

Product_Add.Name: Quarterstaff
Product_Add.Description: This is the favored weapon of travels, peasants, merchants, and wizards. (1d6/1d6 damage)

Product_Add.Name: Trail Rations (1 day)
Product_Add.Description: Trail rations are compact, dry, high-energy foods, suitable for travel; such as jerky, dried fruit, hardtack, and nuts.

Product_Add.Name: Rope, Hemp (50 ft)
Product_Add.Description: Standard rope.

Product_Add.Name: Rope, Silk (50 ft)
Product_Add.Description: A little bit better quality rope. It is stronger than hemp rope and improves your chances on everything you do; rope-wise that is.

Product_Add.Name: Sap
Product_Add.Description: A sap comes in handy when you want to knock an opponent out instead of killing him. (1d6 subdual damage)

Product_Add.Name: Scythe
Product_Add.Description: While it resembles the standard farm implement of the same name, this scythe is balanced and strengthened for war. (2d4 damage)

Product_Add.Name: Large Wooden Shield
Product_Add.Description: You strap a shield to your forearm and grip it with your hand. This shield is too heavy to let you carry any items in the same hand. (+2 to AC)

Product_Add.Name: Small Wooden Shield
Product_Add.Description: You strap a shield to your forearm and grip it with your hand. This shield is small enough to let you carry other items in the same hand. (+1 to AC)

Product_Add.Name: Shuriken
Product_Add.Description: You can throw three of these at one target in the same time most people can only make one attack. Unfortunately, you don't get any bonuses for strength. (1 damage each)

Product_Add.Name: Siangham
Product_Add.Description: A monk using a siangham can strike with his or her unarmed attack bonus. (1d6 damage)

Product_Add.Name: Wizard's Spellbook (blank)
Product_Add.Description: A large, leatherbound book that serves as a wizard's reference. 100 pages.

Product_Add.Name: Spell Component Pouch
Product_Add.Description: A small, watertight leather belt pouch with many small compartments.

Product_Add.Name: Sunrod
Product_Add.Description: This 1-foot long, gold-tipped, iron rod glows brightly when struck. It clearly illuminates a 30-foot radius and glows for 6 hours, after which the gold tip is burnt out and is worthless.

Product_Add.Name: Longsword
Product_Add.Description: This classic, straight blade is the weapon of knighthood and valor. It is the favored weapon of paladins. (1d8 damage)

Product_Add.Name: Shortsword
Product_Add.Description: This weapon is popular as an off-hand weapon or as a primary weapon for smaller folk (1d6 damage)

Product_Add.Name: Artisian's Tools
Product_Add.Description: This is the special tools needed for any task

Product_Add.Name: Thieves' Tools
Product_Add.Description: The kit includes one or more skeleton keys, long metal picks and pries, a long nosed-clamp, a small hand saw, and a small wedge and hammer.

Product_Add.Name: Torch
Product_Add.Description: A wooden rod capped with twisted flax soaked in tallow or a similar item. A torch clearly illuminates a 20-foot radius and burns for one hour.

Product_Add.Name: Warhammer
Product_Add.Description: This weapon, favored by dwarves, is a one-handed sledge or maul with a large, heavy head. (1d8 damage)

Product_Add.Name: Waterskin
Product_Add.Description: A leather pouch with a narrow neck that is used for holding water or other liquids.

Product_Add.Name: Whip
Product_Add.Description: The whip deals sudual damage. It deals no damage to any creature that has an armor bonus. Although always kept in hand, it works like a projectile weapon with a maximum range of 15 feet and no range penalties. (1d2 subdual damage) (Considered an exotic weapon)

Product_Add.Name: Bottle of Fine Wine
Product_Add.Description: A bottle of the towns finest wine. Grown and aged at a nearby monastery

Product_Add.Name: Pitcher of Common Wine
Product_Add.Description: Bottled pitchers of wine, fresh from the local tavern.
